about.description: ctypesgen reads parses c header files and creates a wrapper for libraries based on what it finds. Preprocessor macros are handled in a manner consistent with typical c code. Preprocessor macro functions are translated into Python functions that are then made available to the user of the newly-generated Python wrapper library. ctypesgen can also output JSON, which can be used with Mork, which generates bindings for Lua, using the alien module (which binds libffi to Lua).

ctypesgen reads parses c header files and creates a wrapper for libraries based on what it finds. Preprocessor macros are handled in a manner consistent with typical c code. Preprocessor macro functions are translated into Python functions that are then made available to the user of the newly-generated Python wrapper library. ctypesgen can also output JSON, which can be used with Mork, which generates bindings for Lua, using the alien module (which binds libffi to Lua).

name: ctypesgen
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "ctypesgen" %}
{% set version = "1.0.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/davidjamesca/ctypesgen/archive/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 409ff3984ecf2aef09008045a713d61031990e95834074bff27957430223b729

build:
  entry_points:
    - ctypesgen = ctypesgen.main:main
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=2.7
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >=2.7

test:
  requires:
    - pip
  commands:
    - python -m pip check
    - ctypesgen --help

about:
  home: https://github.com/davidjamesca/ctypesgen/
  dev_url: https://github.com/davidjamesca/ctypesgen.git
  doc_url: https://github.com/davidjamesca/ctypesgen/wiki
  license: BSD-2-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Python wrapper generator for ctypes
  description:
    ctypesgen reads parses c header files and creates a wrapper for
    libraries based on what it finds.
    Preprocessor macros are handled in a manner consistent with typical
    c code.
    Preprocessor macro functions are translated into Python functions
    that are then made available to the user of the newly-generated
    Python wrapper library.
    ctypesgen can also output JSON, which can be used with Mork, which
    generates bindings for Lua, using the alien module
    (which binds libffi to Lua).

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - duncanmmacleod
